targets.expr: kube_pod_container_resource_requests{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="monitoring", unit="core", resource="cpu", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}
kube_pod_container_resource_limits{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="monitoring", pod=~"$pod", unit="core", resource="cpu", container=~"$container", unit="core"}
kube_pod_container_resource_requests{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="monitoring", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", resource="memory", unit="byte"}
kube_pod_container_resource_limits{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kube-state-metrics", namespace="monitoring", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container", resource="memory", unit="byte"}

sum by (container) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kubelet", namespace="monitoring", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__rate_interval]))
/

sum by (container) (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="kubelet", namespace="monitoring", pod=~"$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description:
A time series is considered active if Prometheus scraped new data for it recently. Prometheus provides prometheus_tsdb_head_series metric, which shows the number of active time series. 

Prometheus holds recently added samples for active time series in RAM, so its RAM usage highly depends on the number of active time series.  

The number of active time series is connected to cardinality via churn rate
panels.title: Active time series
WAL - Time taken to replay the data on disk

targets.expr:
sum by (pod) (rate(prometheus_tsdb_compaction_chunk_size_bytes_sum{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="$job", pod=~"$pod", container="prometheus"}[1d]))
/
sum by (pod) (rate(prometheus_tsdb_compaction_chunk_samples_sum{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", job="$job", pod=~"$pod", container="prometheus"}[1d]))

panels.title: Average byte size of each sample ingested
Agent:  Number of active series being tracked by the WAL storage

panels.description: Total number of memory-mapped chunk corruptions
panels.title: WAL MMap Chunk corruptions
Agent:  Total number of samples appended to the storage

panels.description: Total number snapshot replays that failed
panels.title: WAL - Total number snapshot replays that failed

panels.description:
prometheus_tsdb_head_samples_appended_total
The rate of this metric indicates the ingestion rate of every instance.
panels.title: Samples ingest/s

targets.expr:
rate(prometheus_target_interval_length_seconds_sum{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", container="prometheus",  pod=~"$pod", job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])

/ 
rate(prometheus_target_interval_length_seconds_count{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", container="prometheus", pod=~"$pod",  job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])

avg_over_time(prometheus_engine_queries{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", container="prometheus",  pod=~"$pod", job="$job"}[5m]) / max_over_time(prometheus_engine_queries_concurrent_max{env="$env", cluster="$cluster", container="prometheus",  pod=~"$pod", job="$job"}[5m])

panels.title: rate API http requests by code and handler

targets.expr: sum_over_time by (reason) (kube_pod_container_status_last_terminated_reason{job="kube-state-metrics", env="$env", cluster="$cluster", namespace="monitoring", container="$container", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Pod Container Status Last Terminated Reason

targets.expr:
kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes{job="kubelet", env="$env", cluster="$cluster", namespace="monitoring"}
/ kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes{job="kubelet", env="$env", cluster="$cluster", namespace="monitoring"}
